text: Nu1 Coronae Borealis is a solitary, red-hued star located in the northern constellation of Corona Borealis. It is faintly visible to the naked eye, having an apparent visual magnitude of 5.20. Based upon an annual parallax shift of , it is located roughly 650 light years from the Sun. At that distance, the visual magnitude is diminished by an extinction of 0.1 due to interstellar dust. This object is drifting closer with a radial velocity of −13 km/s. This is an evolved red giant star with a stellar classification of M2 III. It is a variable star of uncertain type, showing a change in brightness with an amplitude of 0.0114 magnitude and a frequency of 0.22675 cycles per day, or 4.41 days/cycle. It has about 67 times the Sun's radius and is radiating 975 times the Sun's luminosity from its photosphere at an effective temperature of 3,936 K. ==References== Corona Borealis, Nu1 Category:Corona Borealis Corona Borealis, Nu1 Category:Durchmusterung objects Coronae Borealis, 20 147749 080197 6107
title: Nu1 Coronae Borealis
